Package org.jgrapes.mail

Class MailSender

java.lang.Object
org.jgrapes.core.internal.ComponentVertex
org.jgrapes.core.Component
org.jgrapes.io.util.ConnectionManager<MailSender.SenderChannel>
org.jgrapes.mail.MailConnectionManager<MailSender.SenderChannel,Event<?>>
org.jgrapes.mail.MailSender
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<ComponentType>, Channel, ComponentType, Eligible, Manager
public class MailSender extends MailConnectionManager<MailSender.SenderChannel,Event<?>>
A component that sends mail using a system wide or user specific connection.

The system wide connection is created upon the start of the component. Additional connections can be created by firing events of type OpenMailSender.

  • Constructor Details

    • MailSender

      public MailSender(Channel componentChannel)
      Creates a new component base with its channel set to the given channel.

      As a special case Channel.SELF can be passed to the constructor to make the component use itself as channel. The special value is necessary as you obviously cannot pass an object to be constructed to its constructor.

      Parameters:
      componentChannel - the channel that the component’s handlers listen on by default and that Manager.fire(Event, Channel...) sends the event to

  • Method Details

    • connectionsGenerate

      protected boolean connectionsGenerate()
      Description copied from class: ConnectionManager
      If connections are event generators, register the component as generator upon the creation of the first connection and unregister it when closing the last one.
      Specified by:

      Returns:

      public MailSender setMailProperties(Map<String,String> props)
      Sets the mail properties.

      See the Jakarta Mail documentation for available settings.

    • setMaxIdleTime

      public MailSender setMaxIdleTime(Duration maxIdleTime)
      Sets the maximum idle time.

      An open connection to the mail server is closed after this time.

      Parameters:
      maxIdleTime - the new max idle time

    • onOpenMailSender

      @Handler public void onOpenMailSender(OpenMailSender event, Channel channel) throws MessagingException
      Open a connection for sending mail as specified by the event.

      Properties configured for the component are used as fallbacks, so simply sending an event without specific properties opens another system connection.

      Parameters:
      event - the event
      channel - the channel
      Throws:
      MessagingException

    • onMessage

      Throws:
